definition: to regret leaving/reluctant to part/(onom.) young leaves stir gently in the wind
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
reluctant to part (idiom); broken-hearted at having to leave

sentences.english: They thus coming tunnel don ¡ x't.
sentences.chinese: 兩人就這樣依依不捨地道了別。

sentences.english: Flowing water and green grass witness your lover 's endless prattle.
sentences.chinese: 流水纏繞，小草依依，都是你訴不盡的情話。

sentences.english: Plus, he wants to talk to us all the time!
sentences.chinese: 而且他依依哇哇的跟我們說個不停。

sentences.english: Yiyi is a very beautiful girl.
sentences.chinese: 依依是一個非常漂亮的女孩兒。

sentences.english: He waited patiently while they said their farewells.
sentences.chinese: 在他們依依惜別的時候，他耐心地等待着。

sentences.english: I am attached to my family.
After a while, it crawled unwillingly back into the river.
sentences.chinese: 過了一會兒，大白龜才依依不捨地往河裏爬去。

sentences.english: They certainly in the hearts of Liyuan reluctant to part with the sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 他們的心裏一定充滿了對荔園依依不捨的情感。

sentences.english: All four bade an affectionate farewell to the Hermit and promised that they would soon visit him again.
sentences.chinese: 四個人馬一齊跟隱士依依告別，答應不久再來拜望他。

sentences.english: Teachers and students were reluctant to bid farewell to Premier Wen. The Just-one-hour interactions left them with a beautiful memory.
sentences.chinese: 師生們與溫總理依依不捨地道別。

sentences.english: Offer parting wish to have the time of Happiness with you.
sentences.chinese: 獻上依依惜別的祝願，願福樂時該與你相伴。

sentences.english: When it is time to leave, you will go reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 當你該起程回家時，你會依依不捨。

sentences.english: Silly people who abuse, Lang has been fickle without leaving a trace, why bother Yiyi?
sentences.chinese: 癡心的人兒，郎已薄倖無蹤，何苦依依？

sentences.english: As paper receipts disintegrate, some people are a bit wistful.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨着紙質發票的消失，也有一些人覺得依依不捨。

sentences.english: I'm coming now with willow weeping.

definition: (literary) (of a woman) to have a graceful demeanor/beautiful woman
Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 qu1] or 霓裳羽衣舞[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 wu3]
nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
to bathe/to cleanse/to receive/to be given
umber-black dye for painting the eyebrow
